text: <@U3TR96G84> I usually assign a custom CSS class, and have the styles in my stylesheet
Otherwise, after you publish it. Edit it again and inspect it and you can see the class.
<@U2H1YLSE6> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U2H1YLSE6/FA2CM7YRY/image.png|image.png>
Yup same here, the only case where I add the style there is for CTAs used on emails (because of the preview image is what is used instead the styled cta_button)

OK i did it with inspection. It’s just longuer than before because it’s not possible to do it when creating the CTA
We have to CREATE > INSPECT > EDIT
Thanks all
Noob question here... How can I transform a number with decimals to an integer?
With javascript?
HUBL
I made a repeater to build a module with 1 to 4 columns
and I want to know how many columns I have to hook the CSS
but colsize is rendered with decimals
4 columns make colsize == 3.0
and I need only the integer part
`<div class="col-sm-{{ colsize }}">`
there is an int filter, but the demo uses a string...
<@U2H1YLSE6> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U2H1YLSE6/FA3ERQZB9/image.png|image.png>
Got a link please?
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-filters>
Much appreciated
`<div class="col-sm-{{ colsize|int }}">` does the trick
Boom :boom:

hey guys, I’m currently building an SPA on HS, I’m building it with Vuejs, I’m in a bit of new territory for myself. I need to include a HubSpot form into a vuejs controlled element. I need to change the value of a form field in the HS form. 

I’m scared that vue and the javascript HubSpot uses for the form are going to conflict, anyone know if there’s a good way of including the form into the vue component to avoid causing issues?
Hey Jon, you building with components in Vue, or just several instances?

Take a look at this React component, it might be helpful. Feel free to DM with more code and I can probably help you out:

<https://jsfiddle.net/2Lwq9zbg/>

components, but right now I’m keeping it extremely basic. So far I haven’t separated any sections into separate components yet(the reason being that my vuejs kungfu is new and I wanted to be able to retreat back to the original html easily. should I run into a big roadblock) reviewing your react example now

The key to above being loading the HS form in the ComponentDidMount lifecycle hook. Can't remember off the top of my head what the Vue equivalent is (very similar) but that would be the safest way to handle it.
Edit: Looks like that hook is mounted()

That helps a lot. appreciate it. 

I’m loving vue, - tried react, vue is very similar but feels easier to get used to.

For sure, I've said it before, different tools for different uses. Been working on a React single page site all week, and have a new site coming on the horizon I'm hoping to sprinkle in a lot of Vue goodies on.
Re: flows — what are you referring to? (I’m not really a dev, just tinkering with things) :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U7ADCU3BM> can you share how you found the two API endpoints you shared earlier (for which I owe you a few beers)?

by flows I mean your workflows to work with the API. Like how do you manage to work with the API (directly in the console of the IDE sending by AJAX/XHR, kind of external program like postman with an API key...) you own scripts...

I found that in the IDE itself in the JS console. You need to activate in the settings to log the XMLHttpRequest and you will see where are pointing in the background when you perform the action in the website :wink:

That’s something new :slightly_smiling_face: will look into that, thanks! Re: workflows — I’m using Guzzle and have created my own scripts, initially as stand-alone proofs of concept and now I’m trying to do a bit more
sounds promising :slightly_smiling_face:
happy friday everyone. Anyone know where this link icon is coming from? It's preventing me from putting anything in between the top row and that intro text up top
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
has anyone passed a call recording through our api using this endpoint: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/crm-integration-guide/engagements>
